channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: I have reported the collapsing of the road and you despite mentioning potholes have failed to inspect the collapse by Norman’s brook frankly it’s unacceptable that despite me complaining several times you simply deny the issue, 4th February
item.description:
By Norman’s brook near my house the road is collapsing towards the brook it’s clearly dangerous This has occurred primarily due to wear and tear and heavy vehicle use I would ask that the inspector contact me so I can accurately identify the location
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Church Lane, Badgeworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Very dangerous large pothole just outside no 19 Greenhills road, 4th February
item.description:
Lost a tyre to it! If this is not fixed urgently we will have to take the council to court!!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 19, Greenhills Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A pothole in road problem, 4th February
item.description:
From AHR - Please could you raise an enquiry for a Safety Inspection to be carried out for New Barn Lane, Cheltenham. There is a very bad section of road which I have driven today. I am marked the section on the map where there are several potholes and some of them look to be quite bad.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pothole not been repaired as per report. Pothole in middle of road., 4th February
item.description:
Despite seeing a report stating that a pothole was repaired on this section of road on New Years Eve it has not been actioned at all. This pothole remains on this road in the middle of the road about half way down along with general severe degradation of the whole road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Fauconberg Road, Montpellier, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: TMC - Defects - Other problem, 4th February
item.description:
Give and take 28 days footway overriding 2200x1300x30mm stats required (FW Over-Riding)
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: TMC - Defects - Other problem, 4th February
item.description:
NWD Give and take footway overriding PLEASE BRING X4 BARRIERS AND X8 SANDBAGS PLACE AROUND DAMAGED FOOTWAY (FW Over-Riding)
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Huge potholes turning left onto moorend road, 4th February
item.description:
There is a huge pothole from the gutter going into the road as you turn left from green hills road onto moorend road. On avoiding this you then have to avoid a further pothole in the right hand side of this direction of carriageway. This is getting progressively worse and worse as it seems previous reports whilst being acknowledged have not been actioned.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Moorend Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 40cm pothole and numerous others in Brandon Terrace Lane GL50 2BT, 4th February
item.description:
The lane has numerous potholes along its length Some were identified and filled in last April but there are still lots which are gradually getting much worse. The largest is towards the centre of the lane outside my garage. The lane is used by the local residents of Gratton Road and Painswick to access their garages which are used to house their cars as street parking is at a premium in this area. We are worried about the damage that these potholes could do to our vehicles. Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Brandon Terrace Lane, Tivoli, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Path damaged, 4th February
item.description:
Footpath off stilchester rd on roundabout. Badly organised rd work layout . Forcing large lorry's to mount pavement. Consequently lots of damage to Footpath and brail slabs for the blind . Very dangerous and lots of lorry's serving new builds .
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Brockworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
